thread.title: Lionel Messi lack of celebration leads to concern at FC Barcelona | Metro News
thread.title_full: Lionel Messi lack of celebration leads to concern at FC Barcelona | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Lionel Messi lack of celebration leads to concern at FC Barcelona | Metro News

organizations.name: fc barcelona | metro news simon rice for metro.co.uk

text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 1:33 pm Messi scored both of Barcelonaâ€™s goals against Leganes (Getty) 
Barcelona needed a last minute winner to secure victory on Sunday night â€“ with who else but Lionel Messi coming to the rescue. 
Level 1-1 with Leganes â€“ a team 17th in La Liga and battling relegation â€“ Barca won a 90th minute penalty which the Argentinean converted. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
But despite the last gasp nature of the goal, Messi failed to celebrate, simply turning and hugging team-mate Neymar. The apparent lack of joy from Messi immediately sparked concerns that the five-time Ballon dâ€™Or winner is unsettled and even that he could be angling for a move away from the Nou Camp. 
Under-pressure manager Luis Enrique was questioned about Messiâ€™s lack of celebration after the game. â€˜I have not seen it and I am not the one who must answer,â€™ he said. Messi didn't even celebrate his winning goal. Just a hug with Neymar ðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­ pic.twitter.com/o3X1Vsf2W1 
â€” Leo Messi (@messi10stats) February 20, 2017 
Barcelona are still reeling from being hammered 4-0 by Paris St Germain in the Champions League, a situation not helped by their own fans jeering them throughout the game with Leganes. Enrique, who was targeted by supporters, was unhappy with those in the stands. 
â€˜I accept that they whistle at me, that the fans are hurt because of Paris, but not that they whistle at the players,â€™ Enrique told reporters. Luis Enrique looks on at the Nou Camp where supporters made their feelings known (Getty)
